docs.snippet: The Anglo Saxon, after a tardy voyage, reached Portland yesterday. The dates thus received extend to Jan. 5. Severe weather is reported to have visited the English coasts; and of a large number of marine disasters reported as occurring there or...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Anglo Saxon, after a tardy voyage, reached Portland yesterday. The dates thus received extend to Jan. 5. Severe weather is reported to have visited the English coasts; and of a large number of marine disasters reported as occurring there or elsewhere on the trans-Atlantic side, a number had been experienced by American shipping. The political news is of interest. On New Year's day, at the imperial reception, NAPOLEON...

headline.main: THE FLOOR FROM THE GALLERIES.; The Debate in the House on Wednesday. Southern Americans and Northern Democrats in Confessional.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Wednesday, Jan. 18, 1860. There was what Prof. MERIAM, of Brooklyn Heights, would call a "heated term" in the House last evening, after my daily letter closed. HICKMAN'S of Pennsylvania, got into a jangle with ROGER A, PRYOR, of Virginia; and THOMAS J. BARR, of New-York brought down the House by describing the three AntiLecomptonites who now vote with the Republicans as...

headline.main: FROM WASHINGTON.; The Senate Claims the Power to Legislate without the House. The Terms upon which Virginia will remain in the Union. THE ORGAN OF NORTHERN ABOLITIONISM.

docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Thursday, Jan. 19. The Senate to-day decided, by a vote of 45 to 7, that there was a consitutional Congress, and that the Senate could proceed with legislative business. Without doing so, however, the Senate adjourned. The House proceedings were devoid of interest, there being no demonstrations towards organisation. The pledge of Southern Democrats, mentioned in my...
